snippet: Not since Mao Zedong dominated the nation with his masterly blend of populism, fervor and fear has a Chinese leader commanded as much public awe as President Xi Jinping.
abstract: Chinese Pres Xi Jinping has become icon akin in stature to Mao Zedong, largely due to way Communist Party propaganda machine has been portraying him; his immediate predecessors tended to avoid spotlight; many critics are alarmed at the zealous promotion, which they say seems like personality cult that has echoes of hubris that affected Mao.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs reported from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong. Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Not since Mao Zedong dominated the nation with his masterly blend of populism, fervor and fear has a Chinese leader commanded as much public awe as President Xi Jinping.

headline.main: Move Over Mao: Beloved ‘Papa Xi’ Awes China
headline.print_headline: Move Over Mao: Beloved ‘Papa Xi’ Awes China
